body_str: As stated by this Court in numerous occasions, " last minute" motions for stays force the respondent to respond without adequate preparation, do not facilitate the work of this Court and are not in the interest of justice. A stay is an extraordinary procedure which deserves thorough and thoughtful consideration ( <FRAGMENT_SUPPRESSED>  A.C.W.S. (3d) 642).

[20] The discretion that a Removal officer may exercise is very limited, and in any case, is restricted to when a removal order will be executed. In deciding when it is "reasonably practicable" for a removal order to be executed, a removal officer may consider various factors such as illness, other impediments to travelling, and perhaps in cases of long-standing applications that were brought on a timely basis but have yet to be resolved. <FRAGMENT_SUPPRESSED>  A.C.W.S. (3d) 450).
(Adviento, ci-dessus; Voir également: Simoes, ci-dessus; Williams, ci-dessus; Prasad, ci-dessus; Griffith, ci-dessus.)
Celis Canada (Ministre de la Citoyenneté et de l'immigration),

Charte . ( , 2006 CF 1394 (CanLII), 2006 CF 1394, [2006] A.C.F. no 1753 (QL), au par. 32 (juge Simon Noël). 2007 CF 111, [2007] A.C.F. no 183 (QL).

[45] 48. 48. (1) Enforceable removal order - A removal order is enforceable if it has come into force and is not stayed. (2) Effect - If a removal order is enforceable, the foreign national against whom it was made must leave Canada immediately and it must be enforced as soon as it reasonably practicable. V. Conclusion
